Reviews.Title: This Camera Does It All!
Reviews.Author: sevenzeroseven
Reviews.Content: I hardly ever write product reviews - just restaurants. I am making an exception for this camera!I waited quite some time to get a Leica. Some of the comments in one of the thread questions that are going on right now are insane. I am sure some of you agree...we can go on comparing products over and over until we die, so why not make some of these comparisons based off what the people have to say that actually own the item, not from just reading the nonsense people have to say when they haven't even touched the product.Well, with that being said...so maybe some of us want the little red Leica logo on the camera, or some of us just don't care. I am in the middle. I like Leica and their technology. Their design is clean and simple, and since this is my first time owning a Leica - I am proud to show the logo.The V-Lux 40 is an amazing little machine. I sold my Nikon D90 with three lenses, so I could buy this camera. When I found out that the zoom is better than the Nikon 70-300mm lens I had [that cost $650, whole Leica cost $700] - I couldn't help myself to find out how and why this compact point & shoot camera could do all this and more. I live in New York, and I love taking photos of buildings and architecture - the zoom is unbelievable! I am getting specific detail on beautiful old buildings with a BETTER range than the DSLR. When they say 20x optical zoom - that is what it means - and it means it adds up to 480mm.To be honest - I would've never bought the V-Lux 40 if I wasn't able to test it out first. I was able to do so by visiting the Leica Gallery here in NYC. I was able to try all the options and learn as much as I could by having a very informational specialist help me do so.Before I decided to part ways with my D90, I wanted to make sure that the Leica had a good macro option. Taking close-up photos is one of the most important parts of photography for me. I like to shoot flowers and bugs and zoom in on anything I can to grab detail. Taking photos of the leaves in autumn is something I have been doing for many years now, so you can see why I need a camera with a good macro.The shutter is quick and precise, and the vibration stabilizer is phenomenal. The camera moves slightly all on its own to try and find the perfect lineup for you to shoot your shot. There is GPS - I never thought I would want to use anything with GPS integration, but living in NYC - it is actually a good idea...it makes it a great way to keep note of where you have been. Another really fun feature is that you can take a photo with the touchscreen! Yup - just like using an iPhone or alike.I will say this - I have only had the camera for a week, and it is odd walking around the city without the bulky DSLR. I do miss my Nikon, but in time I will get used to not having it around. It is bittersweet because the Nikon was/is a great camera, but the Leica does everything and more than the D90 does.I have not tested the video out, since I am not really into taking video, but I am quite confident that there won't be any complaints coming from me when I do get around to trying it out.To sum all the options up right here for you in a review may be helpful:  + Improved 14.1MP CMOS Sensor  + 3.0" Touchscreen LCD Display  + 20x Leica DC Vario-Elmar Zoom Lens  + Increased AF Speed--0.1 Second  + Optical Image Stabilization  + 1920x1080 AVCHD Video, Can Save in MP4  + 3D Photo Capture  + Shoot Up to 10 fps at Full Resolution  + GPS, DVD With Detailed Maps  + Photoshop Elements/Premiere Elements IncIf you do decide on purchasing the V-Lux 40, I hope you will be very happy with it! I know I am, and until the day Nikon or Canon make a significant improvement in their DSLR cameras in the price range I am comfortable in - I am perfectly fine and happy with this beautiful, little piece of technology.

Reviews.Title: P&S; vs DSLR
Reviews.Author: Captmklk
Reviews.Content: Just got my wife a v-lux 40 and I agree that it is a phenomenal piece of equipment, far and away the best point and shoot I have ever seen. It has feature not found on any other! BUT a point and shoot will never replace a dslr! Never! If you are a professional photographer you need the viewing feature of TTL. In my work I shoot Nikons. I wish I could afford the Leica S2 dslr, but at $23,000.00 for the body alone, it's not really feasible  for me at this point. For the typical snapshot needs a P&S; makes perfect sense. Carrying a big bulky DSLR is almost like having a baby with you. They are heavy and cumbersome but they serve a very specific purpose. You don't need a sledge hammer to drive a tack, but on the other hand ya can't drive a spike with a tack hammer. RonP.S. to the girls that screamed do not buy this camera ours came with everything including the battery charger and warranty card and all the rest. You must have been a victim of an unfortunate packing error.

Reviews.Title: Just love the increase in operating speed
Reviews.Author: Sranyoo Chanate
Reviews.Content: Now I can take picture much faster than the previous model. Zoom faster and focus much faster. I just go everywhere with it now.

Reviews.Title: couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: rick
Reviews.Content: well after wading through many reviews of the compact digitals that are available i selected v-lux 40 as a replacement for my canon g7 that failed to power on after 7 years and many great photos.i wasn't particularily price sensitive as much as wanting the most compact camera available with features condusive to use as easily carried daily use/travel camera. the ability to put it in a shirt or pants pocket can't be overstated as far as i'm concerned.the build quality is great, it feels substantial for it's size. and feels quite natural when shooting or at least it does for me. i've had the v40 for a couple of weeks now and most of material shot was just checking out the operation in various lighting situations. i never use a flash so the ability to turn that off with out it defaulting to auto as the g7 did is nice. the 20x optical zoom provides a great range of composition options. the performance in low light conditions is simply amazing. menus for the myrid of selectable options that are available is quite straight forward and easily understood without resorting to the full explanition of everything in the 198 page instruction manual. i've taken to putting the pdf of this sort os stuff on a disc and printing a spiral bound regular sized document that is actually useable when the need arises. i considered the similar sony product but was put off by the configuration of the flash and i didn't forsee the need for 20mil pixels of resolution with how i intend to use the camera. i'm anxious to see if the full hi-def video generated will make my current canon vixia hfs 11 obselete, right now i'm thinking not. whats up with the ridiculous amount of internal memory that has the capability of storing only a few photos and certainly no video ? the video generated was easily put into pe10 for editing purposes. this was particularily accidently cool. i'm not a fan of leather camera cases that attach to and burden the camera in use. sooo.. we had a pelikan 1010 micro case from some adventure and it seemed it might work  as protective case for travel or storage. just get one as it appears the camera was made for this case or visa versa, works perfect. ok what don't i like, not much. in initial use the battery life dosent seem great. 1 or even 2 or 3 extra batteries may be required in travel situations, and the battery takes several hours to recharge. i'm sure i could go on.... but for myself as an advanced amature who will be using it for mostly travel documentation and creative photography work it's perfect. i bought it solely on the reviews of others, sight unseen , but if your remotely considering a quality compact camera be sure to check the vlux40 out as i don't think you will be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Getnby
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a small point n shoot that was disappointing in its limitations.  This camera is very powerful in both its capacity for producing excellent images and providing the user with extraordinary control of all the functions needed to capture quality shots.  Out performs every pocket camera I have seen.  Before buying this camera, I did a lot of research on its Panosonic version. I can't prove it by experience (I am not rich enough to buy both), but based on the research, I'd say the Leica is worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: Great travel camera
Reviews.Author: Gerald I. Malik
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, many enhancements to typical point and shoots. Lots of software and high quality jpeg processing. The scene mode is handy.

Reviews.Title: Thanks to other reviewers I made the right choice!
Reviews.Author: C. Sproat "CSproat"
Reviews.Content: Omg...this thing is fantastic....my husband did a lot of research over a year, and bought a Sony NEX6.... He was over the moon about it.....And then I got this baby.....imagine the look on his face when he realized his ditz of a wife inadvertently bought a better camera than his...har har har....But enough with the back biting.....The most surprising aspect to me is that the image represented in the viewfinder is what you get as a picture!...I have been conditioned to expect that the viewfinder looks great but the image will not be nearly as good. No so with this camera...what you see is what you get!.....I have had a bit of wash out on some reds..but nothing I can't fix in post. The macro is fantastic as well...wanna take a close up of that bird 2 a block away?...no problem.Best camera I've ever used!...now I just have to get a Leica case for it..

Reviews.Title: The perfect camera
Reviews.Author: C. Cruz
Reviews.Content: A few years ago I stopped carrying my big camera due to shoulder and neck issues.  I saved up enough money to get this little camera and have been very happy with it. A point and shoot will never replace a DSLR but this comes close.  I have been able to get some great shots from this camera. The only problem I have with this is the flash. Indoors the flash is just ok. Overall this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: I chose a Lumix  with the same lens for half the price.
Reviews.Author: Jon Louis Patterson "Uber Trekkie"
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix ZS20 is a very similar camera with the same Leica lens and all the great features.  Read reviews of both cameras and consider the price difference.

Reviews.Title: Expensive but top notch
Reviews.Author: Marjorie Connelly
Reviews.Content: The quality is excellent especially given the size of the camera, has a great macro, , the only downside is the price.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant Camera....
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect pocket camera.  Leica produces the finest cameras in the world.  Their cameras easily beat my Nikons and my old Pentax.  There is only a Leica.  If you are serious about cameras then buy a serious camera.

Reviews.Title: Great quality compact camera
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for christmas and she's been having a ball using it. It takes great photos and videos and the 3" screen is a nice size. It's difficult to see your subject when outdoors in the sunlight or a dark environment but what camera isn't when you don't have a view finder.

Reviews.Title: "Body only" means body only
Reviews.Author: Kathy Beagle
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware!!! Do NOT buy this product!  Leica's are wonderful cameras--but this one does NOT come with a charger.  You cannot charge the battery.  When it says, body only, it means you will have to find a source for a battery charger.  It is not included. I have used 2 digital Leica camera's in the past.  Both were wonderful cameras.  Find a different source for this camera.  Make sure it includes EVERYTHING Leica intends to sell in the package; Digital camera unit, battery pack, ac adaptor, av cable, USB connection cable, strap, warranty card, operating instructions, 1 cd/3DVDs.  This is missing AC Adapter, USB connection cable, strap and warranty card!

Reviews.Title: Deception with authorized local technical assistance charging a lot to manage the camera repair during guarantee in Brazil.
Reviews.Author: Marcos Gouvea de Souza
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera last December and last week stopped working and the local Leica authorized technical assistance, in Brazil,  asked equivalent to US$ 195, to manage to send the camera to the USA and to repair, forecasting something around 30-60 days to get it back.Why is necessary a local authorized technical assistance that is not able to repair here ? Why a camera like this stop working after 3 months ?Another problem is the fact there are just 2 option about the built in flash: or automatic or nothing. There isn't an option to force to use it for some circumstances in open air as a way to point up some details.March, 19th. 2013Marcos Gouvêa - Sao Paulo - Brazil

Reviews.Title: Not as sturdy as I thought
Reviews.Author: Ypcc
Reviews.Content: Leica  18176 V-LUX 40 14.1MP Compact System Camera  with 3.0-Inch TFT LCD, Body Only  (Black)Do not get me wrong by the star provided, this is a great camera, excellent lens, focus, pictures, resolution, portability. Unfortunately Leica did not fulfill my expectations to stand behind their product and provide good service and warranty.I purchased this back in June (3 months ago).. have taken it everywhere, taken excellent pictures, unfortunately a couple of weeks ago I had a little incident with it at the office. The camera dropped from about a ft and half height onto carpeted floor, and the lens metal casing was bent, to an extent that the shutter would not close completely, this did not limit the lens from extending or withdrawing and its funcionalities. Finally got the shutter to shut completely but the dent was still there. Having paid close to 700 for this device, i figure the minor dent could be fixed either under warranty or not. So I decided to send it in to the repair ni NJ. There they told me that it could not be fixed and that the warranty did not cover it and it was voided due to impact. Instead they offered to sell me another, new (probably refurbished) camera at a discount (about 20% discount). I thought this was quite the rip off.. so told them no. Now, I am left with an expensive camera 3 months old and no warranty.Being a Leica, German manufactured and engineered (actually Japanese) I thought this camera would handle such minor fall better. I recently gave my mom my old Power Shot S90 that I had for over 2 years, and that was really a sturdy built device.. Next time I am sticking to the Japanese and/or making my purchases with American Express and their purchase protection.. I bought this with the Amazon Card, but Amazon played clueless as well, directing me to the seller (A&B; Imports Ltd) and to the manufacturer. In any case.. save your money on this.. great pictures, but a wimpy machine for the money.
